title: Rotational KE - disk rotates about pivot at edge

content.question: A uniform solid disk can rotate about a fixed pivot point located on its edge, as shown in the figure. The disk has mass <math alttext="m sub D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>D</mtext></msub></math>, radius <math alttext="r sub D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mtext>D</mtext></msub></math>, and a rotational inertia about its center of <math alttext="I sub C equals one half m sub D, end sub, r sub D, end sub, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>D</mtext></msub><msup><msub><mi>r</mi><mtext>D</mtext></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>. The disk’s center travels in a circle, also of radius <math alttext="r sub D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mtext>D</mtext></msub></math>, as the disk rotates about the pivot point with angular speed <math alttext="omega sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> in the plane of the figure. How does the rotational kinetic energy of the disk compare to the translational kinetic energy of the disk?

choices.label: The rotational kinetic energy is zero.
The rotational kinetic energy is not zero and is less than the translational kinetic energy.
The rotational kinetic energy equals the translational kinetic energy.
The rotational kinetic energy is greater than the translational kinetic energy.

content.answer: The rotational kinetic energy is greater than the translational kinetic energy.
